00035 BroadEstepper1::BroadEstepper1(CanaryOptions& opts,
00036                                valarray<double> vals_in,
00037                                CanaryPrior & prior_in,
00038                                vector<int> & clusters_in)
00039   : _opts(opts)
00040   {
00041   N = vals_in.size();
00042   G = clusters_in.size();
00043   _vals.resize(vals_in.size()); _vals = vals_in;
00044   _prior = prior_in;
00045   _cvec.resize(G); _cvec = clusters_in;
00046   _prop.resize(G,1.0/G);
00047   _mean.resize(G);
00048   _var.resize(G);
00049 
00050   for (unsigned int k=0; k<G; k++)
00051     {
00052     int cpos = _cvec[k];
00053 //  The algorithm converges to a cycle dependent on initial values.  If it
00054 //  converged to a point - as it should - it would make sense to uncomment.
00055 //    _prop[k] = _prior.prop()[cpos];
00056     _mean[k] = _prior.mean()[cpos];
00057     _var[k] = _prior.var()[cpos];
00058     }
00059 
00060   _prob.ReSize(N,G);
00061   _prob = 0.0;
00062 
00063   update_prob();
00064   }
00065 
00066 BroadEstepper1::BroadEstepper1(CanaryOptions& opts)
00067   : _opts(opts)
00068   {
00069   N=0;
00070   G=0;
00071   _prob.ReSize(0,0);
00072   }

00074 BroadEstepper1::BroadEstepper1(const BroadEstepper1 & BE)
00075   : _opts(BE._opts)
00076   {
00077   N = BE.N;
00078   G = BE.G;
00079   _vals.resize(N); _vals = BE._vals;
00080   _prior = BE._prior;
00081   _cvec.resize(G); _cvec = BE._cvec;
00082   _prop.resize(G); _prop = BE._prop;
00083   _mean.resize(G); _mean = BE._mean;
00084   _var.resize(G); _var = BE._var;
00085   //
00086   _prob.ReSize(N,G);
00087   _prob = BE._prob;
00088   }
00089 
00090 BroadEstepper1 & BroadEstepper1::operator=(const BroadEstepper1 & BE)
00091   {
00092   if (this == &BE) return *this;
00093   //
00094   this->_opts=BE._opts;
00095   //
00096   this->N = BE.N;
00097   this->G = BE.G;
00098   this->_vals.resize(this->N); this->_vals = BE._vals;
00099   this->_prior = BE._prior;
00100   this->_cvec.resize(this->G); this->_cvec = BE._cvec;
00101   this->_prop.resize(this->G); this->_prop = BE._prop;
00102   this->_mean.resize(this->G); this->_mean = BE._mean;
00103   this->_var.resize(this->G); this->_var = BE._var;
00104   this->_prob.ReSize(N,G);
00105   this->_prob = BE._prob;
00106 
00107   return *this;
00108   }

00111 void BroadEstepper1::update_broad()
00112   {
00113   update_prop_broad();
00114   update_mean_broad();
00115   update_var_broad();
00116   update_prob();
00117   }
00118 
00119 
00120 void BroadEstepper1::update_prop_broad()
00121   {
00122   double sum_prob = _prob.Sum();
00123 
00124   for (int k=0; k<G; k++)
00125     {
00126     double sum_k=0.0;
00127     for (int i=0; i<N; i++) sum_k += _prob.element(i,k);
00128     _prop[k] = sum_k/sum_prob;
00129     }
00130   }
00131 
00132 
00133 void BroadEstepper1::update_mean_broad()
00134   {
00135   int PPF=_opts.tune_pseudopoint_factor; 
00136   valarray<double>pmean(G);
00137   for (int k=0; k<G; k++) pmean[k] = _prior.mean(_cvec[k]);
00138   int num_pseudopoints = int(N/PPF);
00139   if (!num_pseudopoints) num_pseudopoints = 1;
00140   valarray<double>xmean(0.0,G);
00141 
00142   for (int k=0; k<G; k++)
00143     {
00144     double kwsum=0.0, wsum=0.0;
00145     for (int i=0; i<N; i++)
00146       {
00147       kwsum += _vals[i]*_prob.element(i,k);
00148       wsum += _prob.element(i,k);
00149       if (wsum > 0.0) xmean[k] = kwsum/wsum;
00150       }
00151     }
00152 
00153   for (int k=0; k<G; k++)
00154     {
00155     _mean[k] = xmean[k]*N*_prop[k] + pmean[k]*num_pseudopoints;
00156     _mean[k] /= N*_prop[k] + num_pseudopoints;
00157     }
00158   }
00159 
00160 
00161 void BroadEstepper1::update_var_broad()
00162   {
00163   valarray<double>xvar(0.0,G);
00164 
00165   for (int k=0; k<G; k++)
00166     {
00167     double kwsum=0.0, wsum=0.0;
00168     for (int i=0; i<N; i++)
00169       {
00170       double diff = _vals[i] - _mean[k];
00171       kwsum += _prob.element(i,k)*diff*diff;
00172       wsum += _prob.element(i,k);
00173       }
00174     if (wsum > 0.0) xvar[k] = kwsum/wsum;
00175     else xvar[k] = _opts.tune_min_cluster_variance;
00176     }
00177 
00178   double mean_var = xvar.sum()/xvar.size();
00179   double reg_weight = _opts.tune_regularize_variance_factor;
00180   _var = reg_weight*mean_var + (1.0 - reg_weight)*xvar;
00181   }
00182 
00183 
00184 void BroadEstepper1::update_prob()
00185   {
00186   for (int i=0; i<N; i++)
00187     {
00188     valarray<double>xprobs(0.0,G);
00189     for (int k=0; k<G; k++)
00190       {
00191       double diff = _vals[i] - _mean[k];
00192       xprobs[k] = _prop[k]*exp(-0.5*diff*diff/_var[k])/sqrt(_var[k]);
00193       }
00194 
00195     double sum_probs = xprobs.sum();
00196 
00197     // just in case all clusters are very unlikely
00198     if (sum_probs < 1e-10)
00199       for (int k=0; k<G; k++) _prob.element(i,k) = 1.0/G;
00200 
00201     else for (int k=0; k<G; k++)
00202         _prob.element(i,k) = xprobs[k]/sum_probs;
00203     }
00204   }

00206 
00207 double BroadEstepper1::log_likelihood()
00208   {
00209   double log_likelihood_sum = 0.0;
00210 
00211   for (int i=0; i<N; i++)
00212     {
00213     double this_likelihood = FLT_MIN;
00214     for (int k=0; k<G; k++)
00215       {
00216       double diff = _vals[i] - _mean[k];
00217         // here is an example of how sensitive the algorithm is
00218         // uncommenting this line for numerical stability has a
00219         // large effect on over 1 percent of the CNVs
00220 //      if (diff*diff/_var[k] > 100.0) continue;
00221 
00222       double prob = exp(-0.5*(diff*diff/_var[k]));
00223       prob /= sqrt(2.0*M_PI*_var[k]);
00224       prob *= _prop[k];
00225       this_likelihood += prob;
00226       }
00227     log_likelihood_sum += log(this_likelihood);
00228     }
00229 
00230   return log_likelihood_sum;
00231   }

00233 //vector<pair<int,double> > BroadEstepper1::confidences()
00234 vector<double> BroadEstepper1::confidences()
00235   {
00236   double norm_const = 1.0/sqrt(2.0*M_PI);
00237 //  vector<pair<int,double> >ret_vec;
00238   vector<double> ret_vec;
00239   for (unsigned int i=0; i<N; i++)
00240     {
00241 //    int best_clust = -1;
00242     double best_prob = 0.0;
00243     double total_prob = 0.0;
00244     for (unsigned int k=0; k<_cvec.size(); k++)
00245       {
00246       double dev = (_vals[i] - _mean[k])/sqrt(_var[k]);
00247 
00248       // look into how to better handle small probabilities
00249       double prob = FLT_MIN;
00250       if (abs(dev) > FLT_MIN) prob = norm_const*exp(-0.5*dev*dev);
00251       total_prob += prob;
00252       if (prob > best_prob)
00253         {
00254         best_prob = prob;
00255 //        best_clust = _cvec[k];
00256         }
00257       }
00258 //      pair<int,float> val(best_clust,best_prob/total_prob);
00259 //      ret_vec.push_back(val);
00260       ret_vec.push_back(best_prob/total_prob);
00261     }
00262   return ret_vec;
00263   }
00264 
00265 
00266 // Just assigns the sample point to the cluster of highest probability
00267 vector<int> BroadEstepper1::assignments()
00268   {
00269   vector<int> ret_vec;
00270   for (unsigned int i=0; i<N; i++)
00271     {
00272     int best_clust = -1;
00273     double best_prob = 0.0;
00274 
00275     for (unsigned int k=0; k<_cvec.size(); k++)
00276       {
00277       if (_prob.element(i,k) > best_prob)
00278         {
00279         best_clust = _cvec[k];
00280         best_prob = _prob.element(i,k);
00281         }
00282       }
00283       ret_vec.push_back(best_clust);
00284     }
00285   return ret_vec;
00286   }
